fast3d.simple

Class SimplePanel3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • fast3d.Panel3d
            • fast3d.mtOpt.MultiThreadPanel3d
              • fast3d.simple.SimplePanel3d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TurtlePanel3d

    public class SimplePanel3d
extends MultiThreadPanel3d
    a default implementation of Panel3d with various features to simplify coding
    it is highly recommended from subclasses to call super on preRender() and render()
    Author:
    Tim Trense
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FrameRate frameRate() 
      Camera getCam()
      equivalent to getUni().getCam()
      SimpleUniverse getUni()
      equivalent to getUniverse() but returning the SimpleUniverse, because a SimplePanel3d in any case holds a SimpleUniverse
      java.awt.Cursor hideCursor()
      sets the cursor image to a plain transparent image
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called on every paintComponent-call
      draws the universe
      subclasses are requested to call super, because of the automatically render of the universe
      void setClickListener(ClickListener3d cl, ClickMode cm)
      it is possible to react on clicks in the 3d-universe directly by registering a ClickListener3d and the information how to interpret clicks on this component

      packs this component as the content-pane to a JFrame and sets it visible

      • getUni

        public SimpleUniverse getUni()
        equivalent to getUniverse() but returning the SimpleUniverse, because a SimplePanel3d in any case holds a SimpleUniverse
        Returns:
        the universe containing all the 3d-objects

      • setClickListener

        public void setClickListener(ClickListener3d cl,
                             ClickMode cm)
        it is possible to react on clicks in the 3d-universe directly by registering a ClickListener3d and the information how to interpret clicks on this component
        Parameters:
        cl - the clickListener receiving the information about the targeted 3d-objects
        cm - the information how to interpret a click on this component

      • showInFrame

        public javax.swing.JFrame showInFrame(boolean fullScreen,
                                      boolean exitOnClose)
        packs this component as the content-pane to a JFrame and sets it visible
        Parameters:
        fullScreen - whether the JFrame to be full screen size and undecorated (on false: size is 500x500 and decorated)
        exitOnClose - whether to exit the jvm on close (on false: do nothing on close is applied)
        Returns:
        the JFrame which contains this and is visible

      • showInFrame

        public javax.swing.JFrame showInFrame(boolean fullScreen)
        packs this component as the content-pane to a JFrame and sets it visible
        a wrapper to showInFrame(fullScreen,true);
        Parameters:
        fullScreen - whether the JFrame to be full screen size and undecorated
        Returns:
        the JFrame which contains this and is visible
        See Also:
